intro: Wurmbea graniticola, commonly known as the granite wormplant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its underground bulbs and strap-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
